title: Ex-Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia isn’t panicking over Will Campbell’s play
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' rookie left tackle Will Campbell allowed 14 pressures during the Super Bowl loss to the Seahawks.
Former coach Dante Scarnecchia supports keeping Campbell at left tackle despite his struggles at the end of the season.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel confirms Campbell will remain at left tackle, dismissing suggestions to move him to guard.

title: Video: Mike Vrabel shares message to distraught Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel comforted Patriots players after a 29-13 loss to Seattle in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium.
Vrabel emphasized unity and future goals, telling players they have more football ahead despite the defeat.
The Patriots' 2025 season was a success with 14 wins and an AFC East title under Vrabel's first year as head coach.

title: Patriots reportedly make changes to coaching staff, move Williams to ‘high-ranking’ role
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots have moved Terrell Williams to a high-ranking role after his recovery from cancer.
Zak Kuhr is the top candidate for the Patriots' defensive coordinator role after a successful interim season.
New England's defense ranked fourth in points allowed, contributing significantly to their Super Bowl LX run.

title: Pittsfield man, 69, killed in hit-and-run crash that dragged him ‘lengthy distance,’ DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Colbert, 69, was killed in a hit-and-run in Pittsfield after being dragged by a car.
The incident occurred near Linden Street and Francis Avenue late Tuesday; the car was a dark-colored sedan.
Police are seeking the driver and encourage anyone with information to contact Pittsfield police.

title: ‘This is only the beginning’: Ann Michael Maye shares encouraging message after Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots lost Super Bowl LX to Seahawks 29-13, after being shut out for first three quarters.
Ann Michael Maye shared a message of gratitude and encouragement on Instagram following the Patriots' Super Bowl loss.
Quarterback Drake Maye praised his wife's adaptability and expressed excitement about spending the offseason together.

title: This dad is running Boston to give back to Boston Children’s Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Plymouth resident Nick Gallagher, 38, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Boston Children’s Hospital's Miles for Miracles team.
Gallagher's son, a patient at Boston Children’s, has inspired him to run and give back to the hospital's neurology team.
Gallagher's participation aims to support other families in receiving life-changing care from Boston Children's Hospital.

title: Her great-grandfather ran the Boston Marathon in 1920. Now she’s doing the same.
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Juliette Barney, 23, from Braintree, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon supporting the Youth Advocacy Foundation.
Her great-grandfather ran the Boston Marathon in 1920, finishing 16th; Barney aims to honor his legacy.
The Youth Advocacy Foundation assists youth facing systemic barriers, providing legal support and educational advocacy.

title: Should Boston rebuild Madison Park at Roxbury’s P-3 site?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Boston city leaders, developers, and community members debate redeveloping Roxbury's 7.7-acre P-3 site for a new Madison Park High School.
The original mixed-use project by HYM Investment Group and My City at Peace stalled due to low demand for lab space.
Mayor Michelle Wu considers rebuilding Madison Park Technical Vocational High School financially viable, diverging from initial plans.

title: Tom Brady roasts Logan Paul, calls wrestler’s athletic abilities ‘cute’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tom Brady dismissed Logan Paul's athletic prowess during an exchange on Paul's "IMPAULSIVE" podcast ahead of a flag football game.
Brady and Paul will compete in the Fanatics Flag Football Classic in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, on March 21, 2026.
The event will feature teams of current and former NFL stars, with live broadcasts on Fox Sports and Tubi.

title: Massachusetts emergency room wait times rank among the longest in the U.S.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts ranks third in the U.S. for longest ER wait times, averaging 189 minutes per visit.
Capacity constraints and workforce shortages contribute to prolonged ER waits in Massachusetts hospitals.
Behavioral health visits make up nearly 39% of ER cases, exacerbating wait times and system strain.
